task.summary: Default task
File restructure
Added angular frontend
Tweaked angular front end settings and file structure
gitignore attempts
Put the angular file back into the main solution directory as it was causing so much hassle
Migrated from Sql server to postgres to try and get this thing running on unix
Playing around with the front end page hitting up the user's API and display data
Trying to get NLog up and running
Added bootstrap and font-awesome to the project files, rather than rely on the CDN
Created a new users component and removed the user information that was previously in the app component over to the user
Messing around with users components styling
Updated the code style config to prevent line wrapping. I hate automatic line wrapping :(
Playing around with filtering tables and animating in Angular. It's interesting!
Created an IUser interface to play around with strong typing with components
Redirected the output path of compiled css files
Created a users service for handling data retrieval but I am still unsure about Observables and how best to use them
Created a users service for handling data retrieval but I am still unsure about Observables and how best to use them

Fleshed out the users service with CRUD methods. I'm trying to get to grips with Observables and how to use them but to be honest, no resources that I have found are all that convincing. Everything I have read uses the service store as a streaming array, but that is horrifically inefficient whenever you want to update/delete/do anything. Using a set the internal data store would be so much better, but then you lose the ability to expose that as an Observable. Personally, I don't care about that, as long as the data store is kept up to date but the subscription within the loadAll() method. I'm not sure, so I will need to do some testing.
I broke the project with the last commit :3
Reverted the usage of Observables in the Users Component in favour of Promises. Let's stick to what I know for now and will investigate Observables for when I can think of a good use-case.

Created a new Posts Controller and separated the routes that used to sit in the Users controller into the Posts. Also amended the DeletePostCommand to only have to take in the post Id, not the whole post object.
Changed the log for a post snippet property
Don't preface sub route strings in route annotation
Delete commands now return the int Ids of affected entities, not a boolean
Changed app title in index.html
Created IPost on frontend
Forgot to add in the changes to Startup.cs when changing the return type of Delete commands
Name the underlying data structure in the users service
Skeleton for a posts service

Got Users Creating and Deleting from the front end - Delete routes now take the Ids to delete from the URL, not Body as Angular does not support that - I now actually return data in the promise resolves... - Entity interfaces now have an optional Id field so we can use it when sending data to create (e.g. we don't have an Id) - Fixed an issue in the DeleteUsersCommandHandler where we were trying to retrieve the Ids of entities we have just deleted.
Added some styles
Removed unecessary styles
Added a super basic home component
Added a user detail component for editing user information
Added routing
Created a new query & handler for getting all the posts in the application
Created a component for adding a new user
Added new route for getting all posts
Added a grey background to the body element
Handler for getting all posts query
Front end changes: - Added a bunch of components for posts - Added a UI Kit to sit on top of bootstrap - Folder structure house keeping
Change AuthorId on Comment to an INT
Stashing progress
Can now edit a post

MESSAGE.value: Reverted the usage of Observables in the Users Component in favour of Promises. Let's stick to what I know for now and will investigate Observables for when I can think of a good use-case.

Created a new Posts Controller and separated the routes that used to sit in the Users controller into the Posts. Also amended the DeletePostCommand to only have to take in the post Id, not the whole post object.
Changed the log for a post snippet property
Don't preface sub route strings in route annotation
Delete commands now return the int Ids of affected entities, not a boolean
Changed app title in index.html
Created IPost on frontend
Forgot to add in the changes to Startup.cs when changing the return type of Delete commands
Name the underlying data structure in the users service
Skeleton for a posts service

Got Users Creating and Deleting from the front end - Delete routes now take the Ids to delete from the URL, not Body as Angular does not support that - I now actually return data in the promise resolves... - Entity interfaces now have an optional Id field so we can use it when sending data to create (e.g. we don't have an Id) - Fixed an issue in the DeleteUsersCommandHandler where we were trying to retrieve the Ids of entities we have just deleted.
Added some styles
Removed unecessary styles
Added a super basic home component
Added a user detail component for editing user information
Added routing
Created a new query & handler for getting all the posts in the application
Created a component for adding a new user
Added new route for getting all posts
Added a grey background to the body element
Handler for getting all posts query
Front end changes: - Added a bunch of components for posts - Added a UI Kit to sit on top of bootstrap - Folder structure house keeping
Change AuthorId on Comment to an INT
Stashing progress
Can now edit a post
